00022 /**
00023  * @file   SelfDoc.h
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Tue Oct 25 11:57:11 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Small interface to for algorithmic classes that can explain
00028  * themselves.
00029  */
00030 #ifndef _SELFDOC_H_
00031 #define _SELFDOC_H_
00032 
00033 //
00034 #include "util/Convert.h"
00035 #include "util/Err.h"
00036 #include "util/Util.h"
00037 //
00038 #include <cstring>
00039 #include <map>
00040 #include <string>
00041 //
00042 /** 
00043  * Small interface to for algorithmic classes that can explain
00044  * themselves.
00045  */
00046 class SelfDoc {
00047 
00048 public:
00049 
00050   /**
00051    * Description of one possible option/parameter for a self describing class.
00052    */ 
00053   class Opt {
00054   public: 
00055     /** Types of options supported. */
00056     enum OptType {
00057       String,
00058       Double,
00059       Float,
00060       Integer,
00061       Boolean
00062     };
00063 
00064     std::string name;           ///< Name of option.
00065     enum SelfDoc::Opt::OptType type; ///< What data type is our option.
00066     std::string value;          ///< Current value for option.
00067     std::string defaultVal;     ///< Default value for option.
00068     std::string minVal;         ///< Minimum value acceptable for numeric types, or NA if not used.
00069     std::string maxVal;         ///< Maximum value acceptable for numeric types, or NA if not used.
00070     std::string descript;       ///< Short description of our option and what it is used for.
00071     
00072     /** 
00073      * Check to see that an option's value is valid.
00074      * @return true if option is valid - false otherwise.
00075      */
00076 
00077     bool checkOption() const;
00078     /* Conversion utilities. */
00079     double asDouble() const;
00080     float asFloat() const;
00081     int asInt() const;
00082     bool asBool() const;
00083     std::string asString() const;
00084 
00085   };
00086 
00087   /// Typedef to make syntactic sugar nicer.
00088   typedef SelfDoc *explainer ();
00089 
00090   /**
00091    * @brief virtual destructors for virtual class.
00092    */
00093   virtual ~SelfDoc() {};
00094 
00095   /** 
00096    * @brief Setter method for name appearing in doc.
00097    * @param s - short name or identifier.
00098    */
00099   void setDocName(const std::string &s) { m_DocName =  s; }
00100 
00101   /** 
00102    * @brief Getter method for documentation name.
00103    * @return - Short name or identifier
00104    */
00105   std::string getDocName() { return m_DocName;}
00106 
00107   /** 
00108    * @brief Setter method for description appearing in doc.
00109    * @param s - description of why/what/how we do.
00110    */
00111   void setDocDescription(const std::string &s) { m_DocDescription = s; }
00112 
00113   /** 
00114    * @brief Getter method for documentation description.
00115    * @return - description of why/what/how we do.
00116    */
00117   std::string getDocDescription() { return m_DocDescription; }
00118 
00119   /** 
00120    * Get a string representation of the state of options in this object.
00121    * @return - string representation of the kind used by SelfCreate to
00122    * construct objects. Looks like "name.opt1=val1.opt2=val2"
00123    */
00124   virtual std::string getState();
00125 
00126   /** 
00127    * @brief Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00128    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00129    */
00130   std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDocOptions() { return m_Options; }
00131 
00132   /** 
00133    * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00134    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00135    */
00136   static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions() { 
00137     std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> dummy;
00138     return dummy;
00139   }
00140   
00141   /** 
00142    * Determine if the name provided is the identifier for a valid option.
00143    * @param name - possible identifier.
00144    * @return true if valid option identifier, false otherwise.
00145    */
00146   bool validParam(const std::string &name) {
00147     return m_OptionsIndex.find(name) != m_OptionsIndex.end();
00148   }
00149 
00150   /** 
00151    * @brief Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00152    * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00153    */
00154   SelfDoc::Opt & getDocOption(const std::string &name);
00155 
00156   /** 
00157    * Look up option with name and set it to value.
00158    * @param name - identifier for option.
00159    * @param value - string to set value to.
00160    */
00161   void setOptValue(const std::string &name, const std::string &value);
00162 
00163   /** 
00164    * Specialized version for booleans as ToStr() appears to print them
00165    * as '1' and '0' instead of 'true' and 'false'.
00166    * @param name - identifier for option.
00167    * @param value - boolean to set value to.
00168    */
00169   void setOptValue(const std::string &name, const bool &value);
00170 
00171   /** 
00172    * @brief Setter method for parameters and their documentation.
00173    * @param param - Map of parameter names to descriptions.
00174    */
00175   void setDocOptions(const std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> &param);
00176 
00177   /** 
00178    * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00179    * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00180    * @return SelfDoc
00181    */
00182   static SelfDoc explainSelf();
00183 
00184   /** 
00185    * Write out a self documenter name, description, and all of its parameters.
00186    * 
00187    * @param doc - Self documenting class.
00188    * @param out - Stream to write the description to.
00189    */
00190   static void printExplanation(SelfDoc &doc, std::ostream &out);
00191 
00192 protected:
00193   /// Name of class or algorithm.
00194   std::string m_DocName;
00195   /// Description of why/what/how we do.
00196   std::string m_DocDescription;
00197   /// Possible parameters.
00198   std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> m_Options;
00199   /// Possible parameters map.
00200   std::map<std::string,int> m_OptionsIndex;
00201 
00202 };
00203 
00204 
00205 #endif /* _SELFDOC_H_ */
